body:
### Problem

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7dbf7990-964a-44c3-8e00-f147dd7c4657)


### Steps to reproduce

export MANPAGER='nvim +Man!'
man yt-dlp

### Expected behavior

manpages.debian.org looks best:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dfa7d0c0-88fb-4f69-92eb-c5d2c29f639f)


### Nvim version (nvim -v)

0.9.5

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

Yes, even worse

### Operating system/version

debian sid

### Terminal name/version

tilix

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

debian

comment_data.body:
> Nvim version (nvim -v) 0.9.5

Please test the latest development version. The [Releases](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/tag/nightly) page has pre-built archives for Linux/Windows/macOS. Check `:version` to confirm the version.
Looks to be a terminal/$TERM issue.
@532910 Your two screenshots seem to show different manpages. Please provide a link to the actual manpage shown in your first screenshot so we can see the source and its encoding.
You still need to test a current Neovim version.
@justinmk NVIM v0.11.0-dev-1471+g64b0e6582a does not show urls at all
Can you try an actual terminal?
Idk, depends on your OS. Kitty will do.
I cannot reproduce this on Arch Linux with tilix either
Need the literal buffer contents , not a screenshot.

@zeertzjq I'm just curious how it looks like for you, could you show a screenshot please?

@justinmk could you say, how to get it?

> could you say, how to get it?

`:%y +` yanks all lines of the buffer into your OS clipboard.

1. get vim.appimage from https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/download/nightly/nvim.appimage
2. chmod +x
2a.
```
% ./nvim.appimage -v 
NVIM v0.11.0-dev-1537+gf4cff3077b
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.1734355927
Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info
```
3. run ./vim.appimage
4. `:Man yt-dlp`
5. `:%y +`
6. paste here and delete last part:

```
yt-dlp(1)                                                                                                                                       yt-dlp(1)

NAME
       yt-dlp - A feature-rich command-line audio/video downloader

SYNOPSIS
       yt-dlp [OPTIONS] URL [URL...]

DESCRIPTION
       yt-dlp  is  a  feature-rich command-line audio/video downloader with support for thousands of sites.  The project is a fork of youtube-dl based on
       the now inactive youtube-dlc.

OPTIONS
```

unconfigured kitty which I don't use and it;s just installed on my system shows the same result
xterm shows the same result

Please also try:

```
export MANPAGER='nvim --clean -u NONE +Man!'
man yt-dlp
```

Does the issue persist?

labels.description: Low-risk, self-contained. Do NOT ask "can I work on this", just read CONTRIBUTING.md
labels.name: complexity:low

milestone.description: Low priority items. We plan to work on this but don't have a target date.
milestone.title: backlog

title: :Man urls look bad
